discussion.p: POSIX now says: "Since the utimbuf structure only contains time_t variables and is not accurate to fractions of a second, applications should use the utimensat() function instead of the obsolescent utime() function."
Suggested resolution: Rewrite the last_write_time setter description to utilize utimensat() or similar.
discussion.note: 20 May 2014 Beman Dawes supplies proposed wording. He comments:
discussion.p: POSIX supplies two functions, futimens() and utimensat(), as replacements for utime(). futimens() is appropriate for the current TS. utimensat() will be appropriate for a future File System TS that adds the functionality of the whole family of POSIX *at() functions.

blockquote.p:
Effects: Sets the time of last data modification of the file resolved to by p to new_time, as if by POSIX stat() followed by POSIX utime()
futimens() .
